title: Harry Styles Together, Together 2026 Tour Features a 30-Night Residency at MSG: Shop Tickets¬†Here
summary: Styles is back and ready to boogie with fans once more with this new tour in support of his upcoming solo album Kiss All the Time. Disco, Occasionally.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Harry Styles is going back on tour in 2026 with all new music. The newly announced tour, called Together, Together, features 50 dates in a total of seven cities with Styles visiting Europe, North America, Latin America and Australia. The tour is in support of the British artist’s upcoming fourth solo LP, Kiss All the Time. Disco, Occasionally , due for release on Mar. 6 via Columbia. The first show kicks off in Amsterdam, Netherlands, on May 16 and is slated to conclude in Sydney, Australia, on Dec. 13. The first stop in America is in New York on Aug. 26 at Madison Square Garden and will end in the same place, Madison Square Garden, on Oct. 31. That’s a 30-night stint at the iconic New York venue, giving American audiences plenty of time to see the star before he heads to Melbourne. A slew of big names will be making appearances on Styles’ tour, including Robyn, Shania Twain , Fcukers, Jamie xx, Jorja Smith, Fousheé, Skye Ne‚Ä¶

title: Watch Ben Stiller Bicker With ‚ÄòLittle Brother‚Äô Benson Boone in Hilarious ‚Äô70s-Themed Super Bowl¬†Ads
summary: The unexpected duo have teamed up with Instacart ahead of this year's Big Game.
body: Benson Boone and Ben Stiller have teamed up with Instacart — the easy stop for moonbeam ice cream and any other treats you might need delivered to your door — ahead of this year’s Super Bowl. In two teaser clips posted Thursday (Jan. 22) previewing the delivery service’s Big Game campaign, the unexpected duo portray a European sibling musical duo with thick accents and even thicker shoulder pads on their shiny, green, ’70s-inspired stage outfits. In both videos, they hilariously bicker, starting with a fight over Boone’s pitchy harmony during an a cappella song about Instacart. title: I‚Äôm With Her Wins 2 Awards at 2026 International Folk Music Awards. Will a Grammy Win Follow on Feb.¬†1?
summary: Crys Matthews won song of the year for ‚ÄúSleeves Up.‚Äù
body: I‚Äôm With Her‚Äôs sophomore album, Wild and Clear and Blue , won album of the year at the 2026 International Folk Music Awards, which were presented on Wednesday (Jan. 21) in New Orleans. The awards were held on opening night of the Folk Alliance International‚Äôs 38th annual conference. Related Indigo Girls, Crys Matthews & More Win 2025 International Folk Music Awards: Full Winners List Sierra Ferrell, I’m With Her & More Lead Americana Honors & Awards Winners Grammy Nominations 2026: See the Complete List I‚Äôm With Her‚Äôs album, produced by Josh Kaufman, is also nominated for best folk album at the 68th annual Grammy Awards, which will be presented on Feb. 1. “Ancient Light,” a track from the album, is also Grammy-nominated for best American roots performance and best American roots song. I‚Äôm With Her, a trio consisting of Sara Watkins, Sarah Jarosz and Aoife O‚ÄôDonovan, also won artist of the year at the International Folk Music Awards, in a tie with Carsie Blanton . I‚Äôm With Her previously won in that category in 2018. They are the first repeat winners in the history of the category. Jarosz won album of the year as a solo artist in 2016 wi‚Ä¶

title: A$AP Rocky Bolsters ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt Be Dumb‚Äô With Tokischa Collaboration ‚ÄòFlackito¬†Jodye‚Äô
summary: Rocky gives Dominican dembow a spin.
body: A$AP Rocky surprised fans with a gift on Wednesday (Jan. 21), teaming up with Tokischa for “FLACKITO JODYE,” which finds the Harlem rapper heading uptown to try his hand at Dominican dembow. The bonus track appears to be part of the disc 2 Rocky has been teasing as a Don’t Be Dumb deluxe of sorts that’s on the way. “DISC 1 WAS FOR ME , DISC 2 WILL BE FOR THE FANS,” Rocky promised on Wednesday. DISC 1 WAS FOR ME , DISC 2 WILL BE FOR THE FANS!üî• #DONTBEDUMB — LORD FLACKO JODYE II (@asvpxrocky) January 21, 2026 According to Complex , Tokischa and Rocky shot the visual for “FLACKITO JODYE” a year ago, but a leak online derailed the track from receiving a proper release. The duo injects a dose of NYC swagger to the thumping bassline, which is sure to make listeners’ shoulders bop. “Harlem World like Mason Betha/ Dembow/ I’m a real New Yorker to the Timbo’/ But it really ain’t a hood that I can’t go,” Rocky raps before weaving in some Spanish and repeating the track’s title on the catchy chorus. The Dominican rapper feels right at home taking turns with Rocky, as she delivers a vulgar v‚Ä¶

title: All of Bad Bunny‚Äôs Music Videos With 1 Billion Views: ‚ÄòD√°kiti,‚Äô ‚ÄòMe Porto Bonito‚Äô &¬†More
summary: The Puerto Rican artist has a total of 19 titles that have reached the milestone number.
body: Bad Bunny continues his streak as the artist with the most videos in YouTube’s Billion Views Club with “Tit√≠ Me Pregunt√≥” becoming his 19th entry . He’s followed closely by J Balvin, who has 15 videos that have reached the milestone. Directed by Skillz in New York City and released summer 2022, “Tit√≠ Me Pregunt√≥” joins an elite list that also includes “D√°kiti” with Jhay Cortez; “Amorfoda”; the Tainy-assisted “Calla√≠ta”; “Me Porto Bonito” with Chencho Corleone; and his collab with Grupo Frontera “Un X100to.” The artist born Benito Antonio Mart√≠nez Ocasio has catapulted to global success with albums YHLQMDLG, Las Que No Iban a Salir, El √öltimo Tour del Mundo , Un Verano Sin Ti , Nadie Sabe Lo Que Va a Pasar Ma√±ana and, most recently, Deb√≠ Tirar M√°s Fotos . The latter four debuted at No. 1 on the  Billboard 200 , making him the only artist to top the tally with a Spanish-language album ‚Äî not once, but four times. In October, Bad Bunny’s iconic status was further recognized when he received the Top Latin Artist of the 21st Century at the Billboard Latin Music Awards 202‚Ä¶

title: Herbie Hancock, Jacob Collier, Dee Dee Bridgewater & More to Celebrate International Jazz Day 2026 in Chicago: Its ‚ÄòVibrant Jazz Legacy Runs¬†Deep‚Äô
summary: Featuring the traditional All-Star Global Concert, event is marking its 15th anniversary.
body: Chicago has been chosen as the global host city for International Jazz Day 2026. In tandem with the event‚Äôs 15th anniversary, a mix of concerts, educational programs and community events will be staged throughout the Windy City from April 1 to May 2. In keeping with tradition, the annual event will include an All-Star Global Concert. Set for April 30, the concert will be broadcast live globally from the Lyric Opera of Chicago. Led by musical director John Beasley, more than 40 artists will perform. The lineup includes Terence Blanchard, Dee Dee Bridgewater, Jacob Collier, B√©la Fleck, Ren√©e Fleming, Robert Glasper, Gregory Porter, Lizz Wright and Jahari Stampley. Hancock and fellow Chicagoan Kurt Elling will serve as co-artistic directors of the concert with additional artists to be announced in the coming weeks. This year signals the return of International Jazz Day to the U.S. after 10 years. It was last held stateside in 2016 at the White House with hosts President Barack Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama, a Chicago native. International Jazz Day 2025 took place in Abu Dhabi. In a press statement, jazz icon Herbie Hancock said, ‚ÄúI’m excited that Chicago, my hometown, is ‚Ä¶

title: Android 14 is finally about to hit these TCL TV models
summary: Here are the TCL TVs that could get upgraded to Android 14 soon.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR TCL is reportedly preparing to roll out a major firmware update for newer Google TV models. The update will upgrade select models from Android 12 to Android 14. The update could also add support for HDMI 2.1 QMS, ‚ÄúSuper Resolution‚Äù upscaling, and more. If you own a TCL TV, be on the lookout for a new update. The company appears to be preparing to release a firmware update that will take its newer Google TV models from Android 12 to Android 14 . Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Bad Bunny‚Äôs ‚ÄòTit√≠ Me Pregunt√≥‚Äô Surpasses 1 Billion Views¬†on¬†YouTube
summary: This is the Puerto Rican star's 19th video to enter the Billion Views Club.
body: Yet another Bad Bunny music video has entered YouTube‚Äôs Billion Views Club with ‚ÄúTit√≠ Me Pregunt√≥,‚Äù published on June 1, 2022, surpassing the one billion mark. This becomes the Puerto Rican artist‚Äôs 19th music video as a lead, featured artist or collaborator. He also rises to No. 3 on the weekly US Top Artists YouTube chart.  A track off his blockbuster Un Verano Sin T√≠ album, the dembow-heavy banger peaked at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot Latin Songs chart in Oct. 15, 2022 and spent 14 weeks atop. In the music video, filmed by his longtime director Stillz in New York City, Bad Bunny perfectly captures the song‚Äôs ‚ÄúYOLO‚Äù sentiment, bringing to life its lyrics about a person who likes to date around and doesn‚Äôt want to settle down.  It starts off with a boy being rejected by the girl he likes, then shows him enjoying the single life, and hooking up with girls, all before he gets kidnapped and forced to marry. In honor of the artist‚Äôs first all-out dembow track, the video also pays homage to Dominican culture, showing scenes at a local barbershop and the bodega (corner neighborhood shop). ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a song that was born very spontaneously,‚Äù Bad Bunny said back in 2023 . ‚ÄúAll of the‚Ä¶

title: Where to Get Lily Allen 2026 ‚ÄòWest End Girl‚Äô North America Tour Tickets Before They‚Äôre Gone for¬†Good
summary: The British singer's tour tickets are selling fast due to the hype of her new album.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. At long last, Lily Allen is back, and this time, she’s going on a North American tour. It took almost seven years, but the English singer-songwriter made her return to music in a big way with her 2025 release of West End Girl via BMG, a scathing full-length triumph that serves as an autobiographical account of her marriage’s breakdown, particularly her relationship with actor David Harbour, best known for his work in the popular series Stranger Things . The last time Allen dropped an album was 2018 with No Shame featuring “Family Man,” “Come On Then” and “Apples.” View this post on Instagram The album deals with topics like heartbreak, infidelity, open relationship struggles and the emotional fallout of her marriage to Harbour in late 2024/early 2025 after four years of marriage, following months of speculation sparked by Allen, who was seen publicly without her wedding ring numerous times. The accompa‚Ä¶

title: Google Home is making it simpler to add new devices
summary: More options to get all your plugs and lightbulbs online.
body: TL;DR A new device setup workflow is rolling out in Google Home. You can now search for apps and devices to add by name from inside Google Home. We first previewed this update late last year, and it‚Äôs now generally available. Back in October, we got an early look at a new device setup workflow in Google Home. The revamped workflow gives you more ways to connect to third-party devices, letting you search by brand name to find both apps and devices to connect to Google‚Äôs smart home platform. Now, it looks like that update is finally rolling out. We‚Äôve started seeing this setup process on our own devices with public-facing builds of the Google Home app. Previously, to pair a smart device with Google Home, you had to either scan a QR code on the device or hope Home could detect the presence of a device that hasn‚Äôt been configured. With this new workflow, if neither of those are an option, you can type out the name of the specific device you want to get online to initiate pairing.

title: Samsung admits liability in exploded Galaxy S25 Plus case, user says (Updated: Statement)
summary: The company is offering to compensate the user and cover their medical expenses.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR A two-month-old Galaxy S25 Plus exploded while charging in November 2025, and the affected user reports that Samsung has now admitted liability. The company has reportedly agreed to cover the cost of the phone, medical bills, and cleanup, and has offered $500 per person for pain and suffering. We‚Äôve verified the user‚Äôs claims, including the report from the local fire department and Samsung‚Äôs offer. Update: January 22, 2026 (4:35 PM ET): A spokesperson for Samsung Electronics America has reached out to Android Authority and provided the following statement:

title: Android may be the first official US state smartphone platform
summary: State birds are so old-fashioned ‚Äî get ready for official state smartphones.
body: TL;DR Utah is considering legislation that would designate Android as the state mobile operating system. It‚Äôs not yet clear if there‚Äôs any real support behind this effort, but if there is, it could become official by as soon as May. Life must have been a lot simpler 100 years ago. Not easier , certainly, but definitely without so many modern-day distractions. Back in 1926, lawmakers in Kentucky first got it into their heads to nominate a bird ‚Äî the northern cardinal ‚Äî as their state‚Äôs official avian ambassador, and pretty much everybody followed that lead with a state bird of their own . Now in 2026, when there‚Äôs clearly nothing more pressing for politicians to be worrying about, we‚Äôre hearing about the first nomination of an official state smartphone platform . Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Forget smart speakers ‚Äî Nintendo‚Äôs chatty new gadget will talk to you all day long
summary: You can talk back, but it won't hear you.
body: TL;DR Based on the character from Super Mario Bros. Wonder, Nintendo‚Äôs new Talking Flower toy tells the time and talks at you throughout the day. Pre-orders are now open at $34.99. General availability starts in March. Need another device in your home to make noise at you throughout the day? Nintendo‚Äôs got you covered. Following an initial tease in September, pre-orders are now open for the company‚Äôs Talking Flower toy. Based on a chatty character from Super Mario Bros. Wonder, the gadget will pipe up every half hour or so to tell you the time, quote lines from the game, or just kind of say whatever. An overview video published by Nintendo today explains what the Talking Flower can do. The video says that when active, the toy will talk ‚Äúabout twice per hour.‚Äù It‚Äôll say different things based on the time of day or the temperature of the room it‚Äôs placed in, or on demand when you press its button. It seems, well, annoying ‚Äî and if you‚Äôve played Wonder, you‚Äôll know that‚Äôs a faithful adaptation of the character.

title: Gemini may soon do for music what Nano Banana has done for making pictures
summary: You and Gemini could be making beautiful music together.
body: TL;DR Google already offers some AI music generation tools, like in the Pixel Recorder app or through Lyria in the Gemini API. Now it looks like Google could be getting ready to add music creation to the Gemini app. Music you make with Gemini would be stored with the rest of your content in My Stuff. Watching an epic action movie with the sound off just isn‚Äôt the same ‚Äî the right music can really elevate an experience to the next level. Not all of us are musically inclined, though, which is why we were so excited when Google introduced a new feature for its Recorder app with the Pixel 10 that used AI to help us create music . Late last year, we saw access extend to Pixel 9 handsets , and now we‚Äôre checking out what could be an even bigger expansion for tools like this. title: Google Meet will soon roll out this Gemini feature to more users
summary: Ask Gemini in Google Meet is coming to more users and in more languages very soon.
body: Credit: Google TL;DR Ask Gemini in Meet is expanding to users on mobile and Workspace Business Standard customers. Google is also rolling out support for several additional languages. Ask Gemini in Meet will become available on mobile starting in February. A few months ago, back in September, Google rolled out a new feature for Meet called ‚ÄúAsk Gemini in Meet.‚Äù The feature was only available for Workspace Business Plus customers at the time. However, the Google Meet feature will soon expand to more users. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Your Android phone can now keep receipts of exactly how it was hacked
summary: Google‚Äôs intrusion logging is finally here, and it‚Äôs a game changer for Android security.
body: TL;DR Google‚Äôs Intrusion Logging is now live on some devices running Android 16. Once enabled, Android records key activity so you can check what happened if your phone is compromised. You‚Äôll see intrusion logging when setting up Device Protection, and you can opt in or skip it. Google is changing how mobile security works with the new Intrusion Detection feature , which helps you see exactly what happened if someone gains access to your device. This feature is now rolling out to some devices, months after it was first announced, and it could make a big difference for anyone concerned about compromised accounts. Intrusion logging is a new part of Android‚Äôs security tools and is now becoming available on actual devices. Earlier this month, we saw the feature in action for the first time. Now, it‚Äôs showing up on devices with Android 16, like the OnePlus Pad 3 , as spotted by our colleague AssembleDebug. A Pixel user on Reddit also reported that the feature is live on their phone with Android 16 QPR2.

title: Tired of Spotify‚Äôs mixes? Prompted Playlist lets you generate new ones on the fly
summary: Just tell the app what you want to hear.
body: TL;DR Spotify‚Äôs new Prompted Playlist feature creates custom playlists from text prompts. The prompts can be as general or specific as you want. Prompted Playlist debuted in beta in New Zealand last month. It‚Äôs now expanding to the US and Canada. Last month, Spotify introduced a feature it calls Prompted Playlist . Prompted Playlist uses AI to generate custom playlists based on your text input, which can be as broad or specific as you like. The feature has been exclusive to testers in New Zealand, but today, Spotify announced that Prompted Playlist is rolling out in beta in the US and Canada. As described in a new blog post from Spotify , Prompted Playlist can make just about any playlist you could think up. You can ask for tracks from a specific genre or set of genres, tracks originally released within a specific span of time, tracks that Spotify has tagged as matching a certain mood ‚Äî if you can describe a playlist, Prompted Playlist can make it.

title: Google Photos preps a new look for sharing pics, but could lose a useful tool
summary: Google tries out yet another share sheet redesign for Photos.
body: TL;DR Google devs have been cooking up a new look for how you share pics in Photos. The in-development sharing interface features a larger, animated carousel of images. We could lose some functionality along the way, however, including the ability to easily modify image selections. Modern software is never truly ‚Äúdone.‚Äù With the days of physical media far behind us, and digital distribution the not-even-new-anymore normal, if you‚Äôre not constantly updating your app, you may as well have abandoned it. Google devs are constantly tweaking the company‚Äôs core suite of Android apps, always trying out new workflows and UI optimizations . Today we‚Äôre checking out some of the latest changes in the works for Photos. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --> Authority Insights You're reading an Authority Insights story. title: You might need to argue with Gemini to get it to work on Google Home
summary: The new Gemini upgrade for Google Home can gaslight and refuse simple commands, until you prod it a little.
body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR A Reddit user reported that Gemini for Home initially refused to play white noise, claiming it could only broadcast messages. The AI assistant eventually performed the task after the user encouraged it, highlighting a ‚Äúgaslighting‚Äù trend in modern AI. While Gemini in Google Home excels at context, it often struggles with basic commands that the original Google Assistant handled easily. Gemini is slowly but surely replacing Google Assistant throughout Google‚Äôs smart home ecosystem. While we wait for a broader rollout, most Google Home users just want the basics to work again. Unfortunately, Google still has some work to do, as Gemini for Home sometimes ends up gaslighting users about what it can and cannot do, as one Reddit user found out. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: If OnePlus is in trouble, the OnePlus 13 and 15 show exactly why
summary: How can OnePlus find and lose its form so quickly?
body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority Fans may be breathing a sigh of relief that reports of OnePlus preparing to wind down global operations seem to be inaccurate . But even before this rumor, there have been creeping indications that at least some changes are afoot. At the very least, the OnePlus, OPPO, and realme trio appear poised for yet another disruptive reshuffle, and that‚Äôs never reassuring. ‚Äú realme by OPPO ‚Äù appears to the new name to give its budget segment a shot in the arm, while it‚Äôs reported that the OnePlus 15s and Open 2 have been cancelled , a clear sign of belt-tightening if there ever was one. Something is going on over at BBK headquarters, but you don‚Äôt need rumors and insider reports to be a little worried about one of Android‚Äôs vintage brands. A quick look at OnePlus‚Äô recent flagships is enough to raise eyebrows alone.

title: Samsung confirms Galaxy Watch bug is breaking Do Not Disturb, but here‚Äôs a fix
summary: Galaxy Watch Do Not Disturb keeps turning off after the One UI 8 update.
body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR Do Not Disturb is currently broken on Galaxy Watches after the One UI 8 update, with the setting turning itself off when enabled from the watch‚Äôs quick panel. Samsung has confirmed the bug, which affects multiple models, from the Galaxy Watch 4 through the Watch 8. While Samsung is working on a permanent fix, you can avoid the bug by turning on DND through the watch‚Äôs full settings menu. If you own a Galaxy Watch and want some peace and quiet, you might have noticed a new problem after the latest One UI 8 update for Samsung phones . When you turn on Do Not Disturb from the watch‚Äôs quick settings, it switches off again after a few seconds. Samsung has confirmed the problem, which affects many models from the Galaxy Watch 4 up to the Watch 8 (via SammyGuru ). Multiple users have reported the issue on the Samsung Community forum .

title: The Galaxy A57 proves Samsung gave up on its flagship Galaxy S phones
summary: Samsung is bringing meaningful upgrades where it wants, but not to the Galaxy S or S Plus.
body: Rumors around Samsung‚Äôs upcoming midrange Galaxy A57 have been circulating for months, but the last few weeks gave us more clarity about what to expect, including a full-blown spec sheet that shows an impressive set of features like 45W charging and a large 4,900mAh battery in a slim 6.9mm body. All of this is excellent news for the Galaxy A57, but guess what? These upgrades trample all over the upcoming Galaxy S26 and S26 Plus. This got me thinking: Has Samsung essentially given up on its Galaxy S series? Not the Ultra, of course, but the basic S and S Plus models? Is innovation dead for these phones?

title: Forget tempered glass: The Galaxy S26 Ultra may debut a tougher new Gorilla Glass
summary: Samsung's upcoming Ultra flagship could make screen protectors obsolete.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR The Galaxy S26 Ultra is now rumored to feature a new generation of ‚Äúultra-high strength‚Äù Gorilla Glass. The phone is also rumored to include built-in privacy display technology and an improved anti-reflective coating. These upgrades seemingly aim to eliminate the need for users to apply aftermarket tempered glass screen protectors. The Samsung Galaxy S26 series is still a little while away, but from leaks so far, the Galaxy S26 Ultra is shaping up to be the phone to get from the lineup. Samsung accidentally leaked its upcoming Privacy Display feature yesterday, and today, a new leak suggests we could be getting a new generation of Gorilla Glass on the Galaxy S26 Ultra. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: I tried out Mint‚Äôs home internet service to find out if it‚Äôs actually worth it
summary: If you live in the right area and have modest data needs, it really is a solid offer.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority Mint Mobile first announced plans to enter the wireless internet market late last year, eventually rolling out service in October . The company‚Äôs so-called Minternet service is built on the same network and technology as T-Mobile 5G Home Internet, though its pricing and plan structure work a bit differently. I‚Äôve spent the last two weeks testing out the service personally to see if it‚Äôs actually any good. There are certainly some compelling reasons to consider the service, though it‚Äôs not without its downsides either. The biggest question is who it is for, and whether its trade-offs are worth it for most users.

title: As a Pixel fan, I still have one big concern about the Pixel 10a
summary: 8GB of RAM is not going to cut it in 2026.
body: Last year‚Äôs Pixel 9a was a phone that checked almost every box. For $499, its combination of practical hardware, great cameras, excellent software, good battery life, and seven years of software updates was almost too good to be true. But it was true, and the Pixel 9a emerged as one of Android Authority‚Äôs highest-reviewed phones of 2025. As the Pixel 10a has leaked over the past couple of weeks, it‚Äôs become increasingly obvious that it won‚Äôt be a dramatic upgrade over its predecessor. And that‚Äôs not necessarily a bad thing! So long as the 10a addresses the few lingering issues of the 9a, we could be looking at another top-tier budget Android phone.

title: It‚Äôs time to give up on Motorola smartwatches
summary: Seriously, just buy a Pixel Watch or something.
body: Motorola is no stranger to launching smartwatches. It‚Äôs launched one or two each of the last few years, sometimes under its own umbrella and sometimes licensed through CE Brands (now Vitalist Inc.). And yet, you might not have realized it‚Äôs done anything in the wearable space since it tried to reboot the Moto 360 several years ago. That‚Äôs how forgettable the Moto Watch experience has been. Somehow, though, I‚Äôve always held out hope that something good was on its way. Until now. With yet another Motorola wearable on the horizon, I‚Äôve decided it‚Äôs finally time to give up. I don‚Äôt think the Moto Watch will ever figure out its true identity, and I think it‚Äôs time we all moved on. Here‚Äôs why.

title: Still don‚Äôt have the Pixel January 2026 update? You‚Äôre not alone!
summary: The January 2026 update has dragged on for some Pixel users for reasons unknown.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR After more than 10 days of Google releasing the latest Android 16 update, many Pixel owners report not having received it. The majority of the complaints come from Pixel 8, Pixel 9, and Pixel 10 users. The reports come from different parts of the world and are not limited to a specific carrier or region. Google was already later than usual when it rolled out the January 2026 update for supported Pixel devices . Perhaps it was a holiday hangover still lingering. But despite the rollout having been initiated over 10 days ago, many Pixel users still don‚Äôt have the update. Subreddits dedicated to Pixel phones are rife with users complaining they haven‚Äôt received the January update yet. These complaints span across multiple Pixel devices, but we‚Äôre seeing the majority of reports for the Pixel 8 and the Pixel 10 series. And these reports are consistent, regardless of whether their devices are unlocked or tied to a carrier. A handful of reports also hint at Pixel 9 or 9a not having received the update either.

title: Incident report regrets? Google Maps prepares a much-needed fix
summary: You'll soon be able to nuke all your submitted incident reports.
body: Credit: Andy Walker / Android Authority TL;DR Google Maps v26.04.01 includes code for a new feature that will let users delete all their contributed incident reports. The option will likely be under Settings > Location & Privacy, and accessing it will remove the association between your submitted reports and your account. Additionally, the ‚ÄúContribute‚Äù tab could also receive a UI update that harmonizes colors and hides the bio input box for existing profiles. Part of what makes Google Maps such an excellent tool for travel and commuting is the abundance of crowd-sourced data. Features like incident reports help add a layer of real-time, community-based input to the navigation service. However, users have little control over the incident reports they‚Äôve submitted, as there is no option to delete them later. Incident reports ‚Äúfade‚Äù over time as other users confirm or deny them, but, generally speaking, there‚Äôs no way to delete submitted reports. That could soon change, as Google Maps v26.04.01 includes code suggesting Google could soon let users delete all their contributed reports across incidents, road conditions, transit, and trip issues. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --‚Ä¶

title: Your T-Mobile bill is going up for the second time in a year
summary: But customers on older plans will be spared.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile is increasing its monthly bill by $0.50 per line for certain users. The increase is part of T-Mobile‚Äôs Regulatory Programs & Telco Recovery Fee, which is now $4.99 a month. This is the second hike of $0.50 since last year, but you‚Äôll be spared if your monthly plan already includes federal taxes and telco fees. If you‚Äôre a T-Mobile customer in the US , your bill just went up overnight. That‚Äôs because the carrier is adding an auxiliary charge, separate from your monthly payment plan. As of Wednesday, January 21, T-Mobile is increasing its ‚ÄúRegulatory Programs & Telco Recovery Fee‚Äù to $4.99 per voice line and $2.10 per mobile data line. That‚Äôs a $0.50 increase compared to before this date, when the fee per voice line was $3.99. If you have multiple lines in your plan, the total should reflect on your bill starting this month. T-Mobile updated its bill breakdown support page (via Droid-Life ) to reflect the new prices.

title: Did Google Home just break your smart lights? Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs going on
summary: Google has acknowledged the issue and is working on a fix.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR The Google Home app has an issue that‚Äôs preventing some users from seeing their lights and switches as online. Multiple reports on Reddit confirm that lights, light groups, smart switches, outlets, and more are showing offline in the Google Home app. Google has acknowledged the issue and confirmed that it‚Äôs working on a fix. Are your smart lights suddenly showing up as offline on the Google Home app? You‚Äôre not alone. It seems an issue with Google Home is causing users to see certain online devices as offline.

title: Here‚Äôs how Spotify pulled off a legal ambush to stop that 300TB dump of stolen music
summary: This is what a modern internet takedown really looks like.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Spotify and record labels quietly sued Anna‚Äôs Archive, the shadow library that claimed to have scraped 300TB of Spotify‚Äôs most-played tracks. Anna‚Äôs Archive was not even notified of the lawsuit until one of its primary domains was taken down from the internet. However, taking down a few domains hasn‚Äôt stopped Anna‚Äôs Archive. Like Hydra, the platform appears to regenerate as quickly as one of it‚Äôs somains is cut back. Earlier this month, shadow library Anna‚Äôs Archive, infamous for scraping 300TB of Spotify‚Äôs most played songs , suddenly lost its main .org domain. At the time, the site‚Äôs operator downplayed the situation, saying that domain takedowns for sites like theirs happen often . They insisted it had nothing to do with their recent scraping of Spotify at a massive scale. But unsealed documents now show how Spotify, along with top music labels, pulled off a legal ambush and shut down Anna‚Äôs Archive.

title: Google is testing a colorful new feature for Search
summary: Google Search is getting a touch of color in latest test.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is testing theming and customization for Search. The new ‚ÄúColor your Search‚Äù feature allows you to choose between 10 accent colors. The feature appears to be available for large-screen devices and mobile. Update: January 21, 2026 (2:10 PM ET): We have now spotted the feature on smaller mobile devices. Original article: January 21, 2026 (1:52 PM ET): When it comes to Google Search , there‚Äôs not much you can do to customize its look. You can switch between light and dark modes, but not much outside of that. However, some users are getting a new feature that allows them to give the results page a fresh coat of paint.

title: Google Photos adds a sticker locker just to remind Android users what they‚Äôre missing
summary: Google Photos now lets you save custom stickers in Collections, so they‚Äôre reusable instead of one-and-done.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR You can now save custom stickers directly to the Collections tab in Google Photos. Despite being a Google product, the saving feature is currently live only on iPhone and iPad. Google says Android support is coming, with signs of active development, but there‚Äôs no release date. Google Photos has reached a creative milestone that many users have been waiting for. You can now save your custom stickers in Collections, making them easy to use in chats whenever you want. There is one catch, and it‚Äôs a familiar one. The update is available on iOS, but Android users still do not have access, as per a Google Photos Community post .

title: Google Chat is just now getting a feature Teams and Slack have had for years
summary: A forward-looking update.
body: TL;DR Google Chat is adding the ability to forward messages. Users aren‚Äôt able to forward internal chat messages to external users. The update is rolling out now on Rapid Release domains and coming to all users in February. Google Chat is finally getting message forwarding. Starting this week, Chat users will see a new ‚ÄúForward message‚Äù option in message action lists. Google‚Äôs also built in some clever protections to make sure you don‚Äôt accidentally share info with the wrong people. In a blog post this week, Google outlined the new option. It appears when you click the three dots that appear when you click individual messages, just above the option to copy a link to that message.

title: Sony‚Äôs latest earbuds clip onto your ear like jewelry
summary: The new Sony LinkBuds Clip use a clip-on, open-ear design that lets you listen without blocking out the world around you.
body: Credit: Sony TL;DR Sony‚Äôs new LinkBuds Clip are open-ear earbuds that clip onto your ear rather than sit inside it. They‚Äôre designed so you can hear your surroundings while listening, with three sound modes to suit your environment. Pricing starts at $229.99 in the US and $299.99 in Canada. Sony is back with another entry in its LinkBuds lineup, and this one is a slight departure from the traditional earbud design. The new LinkBuds Clip are open-ear earbuds that don‚Äôt sit in your ear canal or hook over your ear. Instead, they clip onto your ear like a cuff, with the idea being that you can listen to music while still hearing what‚Äôs going on around you.

title: KONKR Pocket FIT backers can now redeem their compensation for shipment delays
summary: Pocket FIT Elite buyers get a gift pack in addition to the discount code.
body: Credit: Nick Fernandez / Android Authority TL;DR Crowdfunding backers of the KONKR Pocket FIT can now redeem a free $15 coupon. The coupon can be used on any product in the AYANEO store, with no minimum purchase requirement. The company also confirmed that all remaining Pocket FIT G3 orders from the Indiegogo campaign have shipped. AYANEO originally planned to start shipping the KONKR Pocket FIT in December 2025. However, the company ran into trouble and was forced to delay the shipping date. After explaining what went wrong, the handheld maker announced that all Pocket FIT buyers would receive a $15 store coupon. AYANEO has released an update regarding that coupon and the status of shipments. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: I relied on my Lenovo Smart Clock‚Äôs touch controls for lights ‚Äî now they‚Äôre gone
summary: It looks like Google Home's Gemini upgrade may have broken the Lenovo Smart Clock's best feature.
body: TL;DR The Lenovo Smart Clock used to let users quickly and silently toggle smart lights through its touchscreen interface. A few weeks back, that option seems to have gone away for everyone, replaced with an on-device ‚Äúnightlight‚Äù mode. While not yet confirmed, the timing of this change and the rise of Gemini for Home feel possibly related. Gemini has arrived for Google Home, and that‚Äôs changing the experience for users everywhere ‚Äî for better or for worse. While Gemini offers the possibility of much richer AI interactions, users have been worried about losing valued functionality along the way, like Assistant‚Äôs useful Continued Conversation mode. Google‚Äôs made a pretty strong commitment to supporting its older smart home hardware , but the question of third-party support has been less certain. Today we‚Äôre checking out what appears to be one big downgrade that‚Äôs hitting just such a third-party device. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: YouTube TV multiview will finally be ‚Äòfully customizable‚Äô this year
summary: Following a more limited expansion last year.
body: TL;DR YouTube TV‚Äôs multiview feature will soon be ‚Äúfully customizable,‚Äù letting viewers add any stream. Multiview has historically been limited to a relatively small selection of channels. YouTube TV will also get several ‚Äúspecialized‚Äù new plans this year. YouTube TV has offered multiview ‚Äî the option to watch multiple streams at once ‚Äî since 2023. Multiview was exclusive to live sports streams until last year, when YouTube TV started allowing select non-sports content in multiview layouts. Today, YouTube announced that it‚Äôs lifting more restrictions on the feature with an update in the near future. The announcement came in a blog post detailing YouTube ‚Äòs priorities for the year. The post doesn‚Äôt get into specifics, only saying that this new ‚Äúfully customizable multiview‚Äù is coming soon.

title: This smartphone runs Android, Linux, and even Windows 11
summary: NexPhone wants to rekindle the dream of a smartphone replacing your computer.
body: TL;DR For smartphone users looking for a desktop replacement, the NexPhone wants to offer a choice of three popular operating systems. In addition to desktop support for Android, Linux Debian, and Windows 11, there‚Äôs full mobile compatibility, including a custom Windows UI. Shipments are expected to get started in Q3 2026, with the hardware going for a reasonably affordable $549. Ever since smartphones started getting really powerful, some of us have been wondering why we need so many other computers in our lives. Instead of a smartphone, plus a laptop, and maybe even a desktop computer at home, couldn‚Äôt we have this one convenient, portable handset just act as our primary computing device, and connect it to larger screens, keyboards, and mice as we liked? Companies have been trying to offer just that sort of experience for well over a decade now ‚Äî to varying degrees of success ‚Äî and now we‚Äôre checking out the latest attempt from Nex Computer: the NexPhone . Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Here Are the 2026 James Beard Awards Restaurant and Chef Semifinalists
summary: The James Beard Foundation has unfurled its list of semifinalists today, all of which will be in consideration to win an award at the eponymous 2026 James Beard Awards. Considered one of the restaurant industry‚Äôs most prestigious honors, the award spans categories such as Restaurant and Chef Awards‚Ä¶

title: Which Galaxy S26 Ultra upgrade matters to you the most?
summary: Tell us which Gaaxy S26 feature could make you open up your wallet!
body: Credit: Android Headlines The Galaxy S26 Ultra, along with the smaller S26 and the S26 Plus, is expected to arrive next month . And while it‚Äôs on track to launch as a new device, most people will agree it offers only minor improvements over the Galaxy S25 Ultra. That said, there are some new details rumored for the Galaxy S26 Ultra that could make it desirable to some users, whether they are using an older Samsung device or looking to switch from another phone brand. Irrespective of what we say, Samsung is already preparing to sell a boatload of Galaxy S26 Ultra units. It reportedly plans to produce roughly 3.6 million units for sale in the first wave after launch. Of course, not all upgrades will appeal equally to every buyer, and we want you to tell us which ones excite you.

title: Survey reveals the Pixel features Google fans want borrowed from rival phones
summary: Many of these aren't unreasonable asks in 2026.
body: The idea of the ultimate Google Pixel feature is difficult to envisage, because who knows what our smartphones will be capable of in five or ten years? However, when your flagship Pixel doesn‚Äôt have a feature that another brand already offers, it‚Äôs not unrealistic to hope that Google will introduce it to its own lineup sooner rather than later. With that in mind, we set out to discover which feature from another brand you want on your Pixel. Android Authority contributor Zac Kew-Denniss got the ball rolling by giving you some options. His article last month broke down the seven features from other phones he wanted to see on his next Pixel , and he turned that shortlist into a poll to see which ideas resonated most with you. His suggestions included everything from motion gestures to widget stacks, and you should check out his article to understand his reasoning. The poll also invited you to suggest your own ideas in the comments. Plenty of you weighed in, giving us a pretty clear picture of where Pixel fans think Google could up its game. Let‚Äôs take a look at the results.

title: Samsung just leaked the Galaxy S26 Ultra‚Äôs long-rumored Privacy Display feature
summary: A new screenshot shows Samsung is finally building privacy mode right into the phone's screen.
body: TL;DR A screenshot from Samsung‚Äôs Good Lock team reveals a dedicated Quick Panel toggle for the Privacy Display feature in One UI 8.5. It‚Äôs expected to work with Samsung‚Äôs new M14 OLED panel and Flex Magic Pixel tech to physically narrow viewing angles. From an angle, the screen should appear black, while the user still gets a normal, bright view head-on. If you usually buy those dark, grainy privacy screen protectors as soon as you get a new phone, you might want to wait before ordering one for the Galaxy S26 Ultra. Samsung seems ready to fix your shoulder surfer problem with hardware, and now there‚Äôs software evidence to prove it. After months of rumors about the Flex Magic Pixel technology , a new slip-up from Samsung has effectively confirmed the existence of a built-in Privacy Display. A screenshot shared by the Good Lock team (via Tarun Vats) shows a new quick toggle for this feature in an early version of One UI 8.5 .

title: OnePlus flatly denies shutdown rumors, calls report ‚Äòfalse‚Äô (Updated: North America statement)
summary: The company added that its business operations are continuing as normal.
body: TL;DR OnePlus has confirmed it is not shutting down. The company‚Äôs India CEO, Robin Liu, dismissed the recent Android Headlines report that suggests that OnePlus is being dismantled quietly. OnePlus is urging stakeholders ‚Äúto verify information from official sources before sharing unsubstantiated claims.‚Äù Update, January 21, 2026 (06:52 AM ET): OnePlus North America has also shared a similar statement with us, reproduced below: OnePlus North America continues to operate, with full guarantee of users‚Äô after-sales support, software updates, and rights commitments.

title: Google Keep might be losing one of its most useful features
summary: Recent findings suggest that reminders could soon be stripped from Keep as Google centralizes them in Tasks.
body: Credit: Megan Ellis / Android Authority TL;DR Google may be preparing to remove the ability to create and view reminders directly within Google Keep. We‚Äôve spotted Google testing some UI changes in Google Keep, such as eliminating the ‚Äòbell‚Äô icon for setting any type of reminder and removing the Reminders section from the sidebar These changes could signal a broader shift toward consolidating reminder functionality into Google Tasks. Google has been working to make Google Tasks the one-stop shop for reminders across its services. Google Keep reminders are already saved to Google Tasks , but chances are you may soon not be able to create reminders in Google Keep at all. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --> Authority Insights You're reading an Authority Insights story. Subscribe to our new Authority Insights newsletter for more exclusive reports, app teardowns, leaks, and in-depth tech coverage you won't find anywhere else. sign up now By signing up, you agree to our Terms of Use and acknowledge the data practices in our Privacy Policy. You may unsubscribe at any time. Google has already removed the ability to create location-based reminders from Google Keep, and we‚Äôve spotted clues ‚Ä¶

title: Survey reveals which Android phone brand you thought had the best 2025
summary: You told us which OEM came out on top for you, and also gave OnePlus its own report card.
body: 2025 was a weird year for Android phone makers. We got genuinely useful upgrades like increased use of silicon-carbon batteries and more phones flirting with Qi2-style magnets, but it also felt like a lot of brands spent the year moving sideways rather than forward. We have some insight on the subject, but we also wanted to know what our well-informed readership thought, so we decided to poll you on which Android OEM had the best year overall. To get the ball rolling, our own Hadlee Simons gave his breakdown when we ran the poll, ranking major Android brands from worst to best based on how their 2025 played out. He obviously considered the hardware side, but also things like software support, strategy, and whether the brand actually seemed to be moving in the right direction. He ultimately concluded that no OEM deserved the top spot, but second and third positions went to Samsung and OnePlus, respectively. More on the latter of those a bit later, but first, let‚Äôs see how closely (or not) you agreed with Hadlee‚Äôs analysis by looking at the outcome of that poll.

title: AT&T wants to fix your terrible stadium 5G, even if you have Verizon or T-Mobile
summary: AT&T‚Äôs Turbo Live gives every phone a VIP pass for stadiums, including Verizon and T-Mobile phones.
body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR AT&T announced Turbo Live, a temporary data boost designed specifically for packed stadiums and arenas. The service hits over 10 major US venues next month, including the Las Vegas Sphere, MetLife Stadium, and Levi‚Äôs Stadium. Verizon and T-Mobile users can also buy into Turbo Live. AT&T wants to solve a common problem at live events: when your phone stops working as soon as the crowd arrives. The company just announced Turbo Live, a new ‚ÄúVIP connection‚Äù made for busy stadiums and arenas. The big news isn‚Äôt just that AT&T is giving some data traffic higher priority. The carrier is also offering this fast lane to everyone, including T-Mobile and Verizon customers.

title: The iPhone 18 Pro is already putting 2026 Android phones to shame
summary: As an Android fan, 2026 isn't looking too hot.
body: The 2026 Android landscape is quickly taking shape. Samsung‚Äôs Galaxy S26 series has leaked to death, OnePlus already launched its big phone for the year, Google‚Äôs next Pixel A handset is right around the corner, and Motorola is getting back into the flagship race. There‚Äôs a fair amount to look forward to, but even as a longtime Android fan, it‚Äôs becoming increasingly difficult to get too excited about any of it the more we learn about the iPhone 18 Pro .

title: Gemini now helps you prep for SATs with free mock tests
summary: These full-length tests, verified by experts, simulate actual SATs.
body: TL;DR Gemini will now let you take SAT prep tests for free. These are full-length tests vetted by experts to simulate real-world SATs. It is also rolling out Gemini features to Gmail and Google Docs for Google Workspace Education users. Time and again, Google has endorsed the benefits of Gemini for learning. Whether it‚Äôs brushing up on new language skills , dissecting topics with Canvas , vibe-coding basic apps and web pages with step-by-step instructions, or even attempting to replace your real-life tutor . Google has now expanded its resources, particularly for students, with a new update, allowing them to prepare for college. Google has added the option to take mock SATs with Gemini. Google says these ‚Äúfull-length, on-demand practice‚Äù tests can be taken for free. It adds that, unlike the unregulated study resources, such as flash cards and mock quizzes, that Gemini or NotebookLM produce, these tests are rigorously vetted by prep test providers such as the Princeton Review . This helps ensure the test questions are accurate and align with real tests.

title: Want a QWERTY phone in 2026? Here‚Äôs a Clicks Communicator rival you shouldn‚Äôt miss
summary: Unlike the Communicator, the Unihertz Titan 2 Elite may not want to be limited as your secondary phone.
body: Credit: Unihertz TL;DR Unihertz, a company that already sells rugged QWERTY phones, is teasing its next phone with a physical keyboard. The Unihertz Titan 2 Elite features a more compact and sleeker design, much like the recently revealed Communicator from Clicks. Unihertz will showcase the phone in March, and a Kickstarter will follow soon. Through 2025, there have been frequent attempts to create devices that replicate BlackBerry‚Äôs impact. In addition to projects dedicated to reviving older BlackBerry phones , we recently witnessed the announcement of Clicks Communicator , a compact phone with a QWERTY keypad. Clicks is the same company that began selling cases for iPhones and some flip-style foldables with built-in keyboards only a few years ago. Meanwhile, another company with several years of pedigree is ready to join the race. The Unihertz Titan 2 Elite is the latest step in that direction. Unihertz is no stranger to phones with physical QWERTY keypads . It has been dabbling with them for well over five years, filling the gap left by BlackBerry‚Äôs decline.

title: This upcoming Ultra flagship was spotted with an insane 300mm telephoto lens extender
summary: A leaked engineering prototype of the Oppo Find X9 Ultra shows off this massive accessory for pro-grade mobile photography.
body: Credit: Paul Jones / Android Authority TL;DR The upcoming OPPO Find X9 Ultra was spotted with a unique 300mm telephoto lens extender accessory. Previously leaked specs suggest the device will feature high-end cameras: a 200MP ‚Äúsuper large‚Äù primary camera, a 200MP ‚Äúmid-telephoto‚Äù camera, and a 50MP 10x periscope zoom camera The phone is expected to debut in China and globally in March, marking an unusual international push from OPPO‚Äôs ultra tier. If you want the absolute best camera on an Android phone, you‚Äôll pretty much have to gravitate towards an Ultra flagship. We‚Äôve seen the likes of the Xiaomi 17 Ultra raise the bar for what they can do, and we‚Äôre expecting more of the same with the vivo X300 Ultra and the OPPO Find X9 Ultra , too. At least with OPPO, a new leak suggests the company is not only going to pack a great camera into the Find X9 Ultra flagship but also equip it with an insane 300mm telephoto extender accessory. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Galaxy S26 Ultra rumors are getting even more colorful
summary: Things are looking pretty pastel.
body: TL;DR Evan Blass says the Galaxy S26 Ultra will be available in six colors: black, white, blue, ‚Äúcobalt violet,‚Äù ‚Äúsilver shadow,‚Äù and ‚Äúpink gold.‚Äù This lines up with previous leaks, so we‚Äôre inclined to believe it‚Äôs accurate. The Galaxy S26 series is expected to launch in February. Over the weekend, we saw a leak that showed the upcoming Galaxy S26 Ultra‚Äôs SIM card tray in four colors: black, white, blue, and purple. Today, a new rumor from credible leaker Evan Blass corroborates those four colorways, plus a couple more. In a tweet, Blass says the S26 Ultra will be available in six colors: the black, white, blue, and purple we‚Äôve already seen. There‚Äôll supposedly be two additional colorways, too, in Silver Shadow and Pink Gold.

title: iPhone 18 Pro may not abandon Apple‚Äôs signature Dynamic Island, after all
summary: More like Static Island.
body: TL;DR The upcoming iPhone 18 Pro and Pro Max will feature smaller Dynamic Island cutouts that will still be centered, a new leak claims. A previous leak implied the phones would shift the cutout to the left corner of the display. The phones are likely to be released this September. Yesterday, we saw a leak that said Apple‚Äôs next flagship phone, the iPhone 18 Pro, might tuck its Face ID sensor under the display, in the process shrinking the now-trademark Dynamic Island cluster and shifting it to the left. Today, another leak corroborates part of that story while contradicting another. Apple news account AppleTrack has posted on Twitter about a fresh leak that says the iPhone 18 Pro series will indeed have the Face ID illuminator and sensor positioned under display pixels. Contrary to yesterday‚Äôs leak, though, this one claims that the visible Dynamic Island cutout will stay in the middle of the display.

title: Latest Galaxy S26 leak is all about its Qi2 charging buddy
summary: Here's a new look at Samsung's Qi2 charger for the Galaxy S26.
body: Credit: WinFuture TL;DR A leak has revealed new images of Samsung‚Äôs wireless Qi2 charger for the Galaxy S26 series. The power bank can wirelessly charge an S26 phone at up to 15W or 20W with a wired connection. The device is said to have a capacity of 5,000mAh. We‚Äôre slowly inching toward the eventual launch of the Galaxy S26 series. It‚Äôs believed that Qi2 support will be one of the new features Samsung introduces to its flagship 2026 phones. Along with that new feature, Samsung is working on an official accessory that will take advantage of that Qi2 support. A leak has now provided new images and details about the charging device. Don‚Äôt want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

title: Samsung partners with Perplexity to make Bixby actually useful
summary: What's this mean for Samsung and Gemini?
body: TL;DR Samsung announced this morning that an updated Bixby assistant will be available in One UI 8.5. This refreshed Bixby will be able to control device settings via natural language and connect to Perplexity to pull info from the web. The initial announcement is no longer available; we‚Äôve asked Samsung why. Bixby hasn‚Äôt seemed like much of a priority for Samsung lately, but it looks like that‚Äôs changing with the upcoming One UI 8.5 update. Earlier this morning, Samsung announced a beta for the latest version of its assistant, ‚Äúupgraded to operate as a conversational device agent‚Äù that leverages Perplexity to answer complex questions. Samsung, oddly enough, has since removed its announcement, with its URL currently pointing to a Page not found error. According to the announcement‚Äôs text as preserved by Droid Life , the new Bixby will let you control your device‚Äôs settings and features by making requests in natural language. For questions about topics other than your phone itself, Bixby will connect to Perplexity to pull info from the web.

title: This is why T-Mobile reps keep pushing its new credit card, and it‚Äôs depressingly obvious
summary: The store employee may have more incentives for you to sign up than you do.
body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR T-Mobile store employees reportedly say credit card signups are now tracked as part of performance metrics. Customers may be flagged internally, prompting reps to offer the card proactively via SMS during a visit. You‚Äôre still under no obligation to apply, but don‚Äôt be surprised if the card comes up quickly and unprompted. If you‚Äôve visited a T-Mobile store recently and felt like the credit card pitch came harder or faster than expected, that might be by design. New reporting suggests the carrier is pushing its branded credit card harder at the employee level than ever, making it far more likely to come up in everyday store visits. According to The Mobile Report , anonymous T-Mobile employees told the publication that credit card applications are now tied directly to an internal performance metric called ULB, which is short for Un-Carrier Leaderboard. If signups are tracked as part of how store employees are assessed, this will naturally encourage most reps to push the card on customers as much as possible.

title: We‚Äôve just lost our best chance at the next great compact phone
summary: ASUS hit pause; we'll probably never see another brilliant compact Zenfone.
body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority I don‚Äôt know about you, but I miss the days of a burgeoning and diverse smartphone market ‚Äî not the hegemony of copy-paste phones we see today. News that ASUS hit pause on smartphone development , quite possibly for good, has perhaps just ruined our chance at seeing another novel and brilliant compact smartphone . It‚Äôs genuinely disappointing. Ever since the colorful little ASUS Zenfone 10 launched back in mid-2023, fans (myself included) have wondered if we‚Äôll ever see another compact phone of this quality. 2024 slunk by with little more than a teaser of future possibilities. Instead, ASUS banked hard on the gargantuan Zenfone 11 Ultra. 2025 passed with virtual silence, and now it seems that any residual hope has been snuffed out.

title: The Samsung Galaxy A56 5G is a decent $500 phone, but that‚Äôs not enough
summary: Spend more or spend less, but probably skip this one.
body: It‚Äôs been a few years since Samsung has offered its top-level Galaxy A device officially in the US ‚Äî since 2023, in fact. Back then, its Galaxy A54 5G challenged Google‚Äôs Pixel 7a as its closest rival, combining a triple-camera system and a robust 5,000mAh battery to win users away from the simplicity of Pixel UI and the reliability of Google‚Äôs image processing. By all accounts, it was a good $500 phone, offering more than enough bang for your buck. Then, it disappeared. Well, Samsung decided not to offer the Galaxy A55 5G in the States, anyway, making its sub-flagship Fan Edition the go-to option instead. And over the course of that break, the affordable Android market has changed entirely. Rivals like OnePlus and Motorola have stepped up their game, and Google‚Äôs Pixel A series is better than ever.

title: How much longer can Samsung keep getting away with doing so little?
summary: At what point do Samsung customers say enough is enough?
body: Samsung‚Äôs Galaxy S26 series is right around the corner, and if you‚Äôve been paying attention to the rumor mill, you probably know that this year‚Äôs phones aren‚Äôt expected to be very big upgrades. In fact, they‚Äôre shaping up to be a copy-paste job of last year‚Äôs Galaxy S25 lineup . Playing it safe isn‚Äôt a new move for Samsung; it‚Äôs become the company‚Äôs go-to strategy for the last several years. As an Android fan and tech enthusiast, this lack of innovation is hard to contend with. And yet from a business perspective, it works for Samsung.

title: No one noticed that Google has fixed Gemini‚Äôs stupidest calendar limitation
summary: Gemini can finally read and create events from multiple calendars, like your work, school, or family calendars.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority TL;DR Google has finally added multiple calendar support to Gemini. You can ask about existing events and create new ones on your secondary calendars. This is great for anyone with work, school, or family calendars. You can also change your default calendar to create events on, but the settings is hidden. It‚Äôs been nearly two years since Google released the Gemini app for Android and enabled users to switch from Assistant to Gemini despite a bunch of limitations and missing features. One of those was the lack of multiple calendar support. Without it, you couldn‚Äôt ask about events from secondary calendars, such as work, school, or family calendars, or create new ones there. It was silly, and people complained about this repeatedly ( 1 , 2 , 3 ) to deaf ears. Now, two years later, Google has finally fixed this stupid oversight and added back support for multiple calendars to Gemini, so any employee, family member, or student can access their full schedule again ‚Äî with a few caveats, though.

title: The 38 Best London Restaurants, According to Eater‚Äôs Local Dining Expert
summary: The stunning dining room and bar at Goodbye Horses. | Goodbye Horses The story of the London food scene is one that includes dim sum, Sunday roasts, curries, pizza, sinasir, rarebits, banh mi, udon, pepper pot, sweetbread suya, and natural wine. Across cuisines, neighborhoods, and price points, all‚Ä¶
